summary: Eco represents a multifaceted concept that has evolved from its biological origins to encompass broader applications across various fields. It explores the interconnectedness of systems, both natural and human-made, and how they function across space and time. This idea has gained particular relevance in the digital age, where ecosystems can exist beyond physical boundaries. The concept of eco is closely tied to organizational design, network theory, and future-oriented thinking, offering new perspectives on how to create and nurture thriving, decentralized structures in our increasingly complex world.
excerpt: The article explores the evolution of "ecosystem" from biology to broader fields, discussing its expansion beyond physical boundaries in the digital age. It introduces "ecosystem architecture" as a new approach to designing thriving decentralized organizations.
